page.title: 01SUMMARY
page.content: The focal point of our area are the villages of Hardgate and Haugh of Urr. The two villages are not very big having around 125 houses between them. Haugh of Urr means 'flat piece of ground by the River Urr' and is sometimes called 'The Haugh'. The houses are either privately or council owned, but most are privately owned. As the villages are so small we have very few amenities, but among them are a Post Office, a grocer, a village hall, a school, a very small play park and an inn. The employment locally is mainly farming so most people travel to Castle Douglas, Dalbeattie or Dumfries to find work.
